##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_StaticVarCompensatorvoltageSetPoint"></a>1.1.1.2.7. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > StaticVarCompensator.voltageSetPoint`

**Title:** voltageSetPoint

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The reactive power output of the SVC is proportional to the difference between the voltage at the regulated bus and the voltage setpoint.  When the regulated bus voltage is equal to the voltage setpoint, the reactive power output is zero.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.2.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.2.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_RegulatingCondEqcontrolEnabled"></a>1.1.1.2.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > RegulatingCondEq.controlEnabled`

**Title:** controlEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the regulation status of the equipment.  True is regulating, false is not regulating.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_StaticVarCompensatorq"></a>1.1.1.2.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > StaticVarCompensator.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.2.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.2.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.2.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_StaticVarCompensatorslope"></a>1.1.1.2.20. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > StaticVarCompensator.slope`

|                |                                |
| -------------- | ------------------------------ |
| **Type**       | `object or number`             |
| **Required**   | No                             |
| **Defined in** | ./VoltagePerReactivePower.json |

**Description:** The characteristics slope of an SVC defines how the reactive power output changes in proportion to the difference between the regulated bus voltage and the voltage setpoint.
The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>1.1.1.3.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

**Title:** Terminal

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

| **Max items**        | N/A                |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectiongovernorSCD"></a>1.1.1.3.6. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.governorSCD`

**Title:** governorSCD

|                |                                |
| -------------- | ------------------------------ |
| **Type**       | `object or number`             |
| **Required**   | No                             |
| **Defined in** | ./ActivePowerPerFrequency.json |

**Description:** Power Frequency Bias. This is the change in power injection divided by the change in frequency and negated.  A positive value of the power frequency bias provides additional power injection upon a drop in frequency.

| Property                                                                                                                                        | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                    | Title/Description |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |
| - [multiplier](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectiongovernorSCD_multiplier ) | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [multiplier](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_multiplier ) | nan               |
| - [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectiongovernorSCD_unit )             | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit )             | nan               |
| - [value](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectiongovernorSCD_value )           | No      | number           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                             | nan               |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionikSecond"></a>1.1.1.3.7. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.ikSecond`

**Title:** ikSecond

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Indicates whether initial symmetrical short-circuit current and power have been calculated according to IEC (Ik").  Used only if short circuit calculations are done according to superposition method.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent"></a>1.1.1.3.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent`

**Title:** maxInitialSymShCCurrent

|                |                    |
| -------------- | ------------------ |
| **Type**       | `object or number` |
| **Required**   | No                 |
| **Defined in** | ./CurrentFlow.json |

**Description:** Maximum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik" max) in A (Ik" = Sk"/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

| Property                                                                                                                                                    | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                    | Title/Description |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |

| - [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent_unit )             | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit )             | nan               |
| - [value](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent_value )           | No      | number           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                             | nan               |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxQ"></a>1.1.1.3.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.maxQ`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

**Description:** Maximum reactive power limit. It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange and not for short circuit modelling.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxR0ToX0Ratio"></a>1.1.1.3.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.maxR0ToX0Ratio`

**Title:** maxR0ToX0Ratio

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Maximum ratio of zero sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its zero sequence reactance (R(0)/X(0) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxR1ToX1Ratio"></a>1.1.1.3.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.maxR1ToX1Ratio`

**Title:** maxR1ToX1Ratio

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Maximum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxZ0ToZ1Ratio"></a>1.1.1.3.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.maxZ0ToZ1Ratio`

**Title:** maxZ0ToZ1Ratio

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Maximum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionminInitialSymShCCurrent"></a>1.1.1.3.14. ##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionreferencePriority"></a>1.1.1.3.20. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.referencePriority`

**Title:** referencePriority

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Priority of unit for use as powerflow voltage phase angle reference bus selection. 0 = don t care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionvoltageFactor"></a>1.1.1.3.21. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.voltageFactor`

**Title:** voltageFactor

|                        |                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.maxIFault](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionmaxIFault) |

**Description:** Voltage factor in pu, which was used to calculate short-circuit current Ik" and power Sk".  Used only if short circuit calculations are done according to superposition method.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.1.3.22. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_RegulatingCondEqcontrolEnabled"></a>1.1.1.3.23. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > RegulatingCondEq.controlEnabled`

**Title:** controlEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the regulation status of the equipment.  True is regulating, false is not regulating.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionp"></a>1.1.1.3.24. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionq"></a>1.1.1.3.25. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.3.26. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.3.27. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.3.28. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.1.3.29. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.3.30. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.3.31. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.3.32. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_FrequencyConverter_FrequencyConvertermaxP"></a>1.1.1.4.16. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > FrequencyConverter > FrequencyConverter.maxP`

**Title:** maxP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The maximum active power on the DC side at which the frequency converter should operate.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator"></a>1.1.1.5. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./ShuntCompensator.json                                                   |

**Description:** A shunt capacitor or reactor or switchable bank of shunt capacitors or reactors. A section of a shunt compensator is an individual capacitor or reactor. A negative value for bPerSection indicates that the compensator is a reactor. ShuntCompensator is a single terminal device.  Ground is implied.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.1.5.5.1.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.ShuntCompensatorPhase > ShuntCompensatorPhase > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.5.5.1.2. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.ShuntCompensatorPhase > ShuntCompensatorPhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.5.5.1.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.ShuntCompensatorPhase > ShuntCompensatorPhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_ShuntCompensatorPhasesections"></a>1.1.1.5.5.1.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.ShuntCompensatorPhase > ShuntCompensatorPhase > ShuntCompensatorPhase.sections`

**Title:** sections

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Shunt compensator sections in use. Starting value for steady state solution. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete shunt compensators has yet been designed, a solutions where a narrow voltage band force the sections to oscillate or accommodate for a continuous solution as input.
For LinearShuntConpensator the value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensatorPhase.maximumSections. At value zero the shunt compensator conductance and admittance is zero. Linear interpolation of conductance and admittance between the previous and next integer section is applied in case of non-integer values.
For NonlinearShuntCompensator-s shall only be set to one of the NonlinearShuntCompenstorPhasePoint.sectionNumber. There is no interpolation between NonlinearShuntCompenstorPhasePoint-s.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasegPerSection"></a>1.1.1.5.5.1.5. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.ShuntCompensatorPhase > ShuntCompensatorPhase > LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.gPerSection`

**Title:** gPerSection

|                |                    |
| -------------- | ------------------ |
| **Type**       | `object or number` |
| **Required**   | No                 |
| **Defined in** | ./Conductance.json |

**Description:** Conductance per section for this phase if shunt compensator is wye connected.  Conductance per section phase to phase if shunt compensator is delta connected.

| Property                                                                                                                                                                               | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                    | Title/Description |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |
| - [multiplier](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasegPerSection_multiplier ) | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [multiplier](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_multiplier ) | nan               |
| - [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasegPerSection_unit )             | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit )             | nan               |
| - [value](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasegPerSection_value )           | No      | number           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                             | nan               |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasegPerSection_unit"></a>1.1.1.5.5.1.5.2. |                        |                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                       |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                       |
| **Default**            | `"S"`                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Same definition as** | [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit) |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_ShuntCompensatorPhasephase"></a>1.1.1.5.5.1.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.ShuntCompensatorPhase > ShuntCompensatorPhase > ShuntCompensatorPhase.phase`

**Title:** phase

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.phase](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhasephase) |

**Description:** Phase of this shunt compensator component.   If the shunt compensator is wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point.  If the shunt compensator is delta connected, the phase indicates a shunt compensator connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_LinearShuntCompensatorb0PerSection"></a>1.1.1.5.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > LinearShuntCompensator.b0PerSection`

**Title:** b0PerSection

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Same definition as** | [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.bPerSection](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasebPerSection) |

**Description:** Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorsections"></a>1.1.1.5.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.sections`

**Title:** sections

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Shunt compensator sections in use. Starting value for steady state solution. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete shunt compensators has yet been designed, a solutions where a narrow voltage band force the sections to oscillate or accommodate for a continuous solution as input. 
For LinearShuntConpensator the value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensator.maximumSections. At value zero the shunt compensator conductance and admittance is zero. Linear interpolation of conductance and admittance between the previous and next integer section is applied in case of non-integer values.
For NonlinearShuntCompensator-s shall only be set to one of the NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint.sectionNumber. There is no interpolation between NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint-s.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_LinearShuntCompensatorbPerSection"></a>1.1.1.5.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > LinearShuntCompensator.bPerSection`

**Title:** bPerSection

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Same definition as** | [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.bPerSection](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasebPerSection) |

**Description:** Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_LinearShuntCompensatorg0PerSection"></a>1.1.1.5.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > LinearShuntCompensator.g0PerSection`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatoraVRDelay"></a>1.1.1.5.17. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.aVRDelay`

**Title:** aVRDelay

|                |                    |
| -------------- | ------------------ |
| **Type**       | `object or number` |
| **Required**   | No                 |
| **Defined in** | ./Seconds.json     |

**Description:** An automatic voltage regulation delay (AVRDelay) which is the time delay from a change in voltage to when the capacitor is allowed to change state. This filters out temporary changes in voltage.

| - [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatoraVRDelay_unit )             | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit )             | nan               |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatoraVRDelay_multiplier"></a>1.1.1.5.17.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.aVRDelay > multiplier`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorphaseConnection"></a>1.1.1.5.22. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.phaseConnection`

**Title:** phaseConnection

|                |                                 |
| -------------- | ------------------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`              |
| **Required**   | No                              |
| **Defined in** | ./PhaseShuntConnectionKind.json |

**Description:** The type of phase connection, such as wye or delta.

Must be one of:
* "D"
* "Y"
* "Yn"
* "I"
* "G"

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorswitchOnCount"></a>1.1.1.5.23. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.switchOnCount`

**Title:** switchOnCount

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The switch on count since the capacitor count was last reset or initialized.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorswitchOnDate"></a>1.1.1.5.24. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.switchOnDate`

**Title:** switchOnDate

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The date and time when the capacitor bank was last switched on.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorvoltageSensitivity"></a>1.1.1.5.25. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > ShuntCompensator.voltageSensitivity`

**Title:** voltageSensitivity

|                        |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [StaticVarCompensator.slope](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_StaticVarCompensatorslope) |

**Description:** Voltage sensitivity required for the device to regulate the bus voltage, in voltage/reactive power.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.5.26. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.5.27. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.5.28. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.1.5.29. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.5.30. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.5.31. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.5.32. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ShuntCompensator > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

**Title:** Terminal

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit"></a>1.1.1.6.5. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `combining`                                                               |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./GeneratingUnit.json                                                     |

**Description:** A single or set of synchronous machines for converting mechanical power into alternating-current power. For example, individual machines within a set may be defined for scheduling purposes while a single control signal is derived for the set. In this case there would be a GeneratingUnit for each member of the set and an additional GeneratingUnit corresponding to the set.

| One of(Option)                                                                                                                              |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [HydroGeneratingUnit.json](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0)   |
| [SolarGeneratingUnit.json](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i1)   |
| [NuclearGeneratingUnit.json](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i2) |
| [WindGeneratingUnit.json](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3)    |
| [ThermalGeneratingUnit.json](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4) |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpSchedule"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > HydroGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpSchedule`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./GenUnitOpSchedule.json                                                  |

**Description:** The generating unit's Operator-approved current operating schedule (or plan), typically produced with the aid of unit commitment type analyses. The X-axis represents absolute time. The Y1-axis represents the status (0=off-line and unavailable: 1=available: 2=must run: 3=must run at fixed power value: etc.). The Y2-axis represents the must run fixed power value where required.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpSchedule_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.1.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > HydroGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpSchedule > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpSchedule_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.1.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > HydroGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpSchedule > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.2. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > HydroGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpCostCurves`

**Title:** GenUnitOpCostCurve

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                                                                                                  | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [GenUnitOpCostCurve.json](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items) | Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs. |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.2.1.11. **Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.2.1.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > HydroGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpCostCurves > GenUnitOpCostCurve > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.2.1.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > HydroGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpCostCurves > GenUnitOpCostCurve > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.2.1.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > HydroGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpCostCurves > GenUnitOpCostCurve > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitgovernorMPL"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > HydroGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.governorMPL`

**Title:** governorMPL

|                        |                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.maxIFault](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionmaxIFault) |

**Description:** Governor motor position limit.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitgovernorSCD"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > HydroGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.governorSCD`

**Title:** governorSCD

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Governor Speed Changer Droop.   This is the change in generator power output divided by the change in frequency normalized by the nominal power of the generator and the nominal frequency and expressed in percent and negated. A positive value of speed change droop provides additional generator output upon a drop in frequency.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitturbineType"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.5. |                |                         |
| -------------- | ----------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`      |
| **Required**   | No                      |
| **Defined in** | ./HydroTurbineKind.json |

**Description:** Type of turbine.

Must be one of:
* "francis"
* "pelton"
* "kaplan"

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitlowerRampRate"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.11. | -------------- | ---------------------------- |
| **Type**       | `object or number`           |
| **Required**   | No                           |
| **Defined in** | ./ActivePowerChangeRate.json |

**Description:** The normal maximum rate the generating unit active power output can be lowered by control actions.

| Property                                                                                                                                                              | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                    | Title/Description |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |
| - [multiplier](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitlowerRampRate_multiplier ) | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [multiplier](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_multiplier ) | nan               |
| - [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitlowerRampRate_unit )             | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit )             | nan               |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitmaxEconomicP"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > HydroGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.maxEconomicP`

**Title:** maxEconomicP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Maximum high economic active power limit, that should not exceed the maximum operating active power limit.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitmaximumAllowableSpinningReserve"></a>1.1.1.6.5.1.13. |                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Maximum allowable spinning reserve. Spinning reserve will never be considered greater than this value regardless of the current operating point.
