##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitgovernorSCD"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.governorSCD`

**Title:** governorSCD

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Governor Speed Changer Droop.   This is the change in generator power output divided by the change in frequency normalized by the nominal power of the generator and the nominal frequency and expressed in percent and negated. A positive value of speed change droop provides additional generator output upon a drop in frequency.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitnominalP"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.17. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.nominalP`

**Title:** nominalP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The nominal power of the generating unit.  Used to give precise meaning to percentage based attributes such as the governor speed change droop (governorSCD attribute).
The attribute shall be a positive value equal to or less than RotatingMachine.ratedS.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitnormalPF"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.18. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.normalPF`

**Title:** normalPF

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Generating unit economic participation factor.  The sum of the participation factors across generating units does not have to sum to one.  It is used for representing distributed slack participation factor. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitpenaltyFactor"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.19. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.penaltyFactor`

**Title:** penaltyFactor

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Defined as: 1 / ( 1 - Incremental Transmission Loss); with the Incremental Transmission Loss expressed as a plus or minus value. The typical range of penalty factors is (0.9 to 1.1).

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitraiseRampRate"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.20. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.raiseRampRate`

**Title:** raiseRampRate

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [GeneratingUnit.lowerRampRate](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitlowerRampRate) |

**Description:** The normal maximum rate the generating unit active power output can be raised by control actions.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitratedGrossMaxP"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.21. ##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.30. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.31. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnittotalEfficiency"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.32. |                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |

| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** The efficiency of the unit in converting the fuel into electrical energy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.33. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_WindGeneratingUnitwindGenUnitType"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.34. |                |                        |
| -------------- | ---------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`     |
| **Required**   | No                     |
| **Defined in** | ./WindGenUnitKind.json |

**Description:** The kind of wind generating unit.

Must be one of:
* "offshore"
* "onshore"

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.35. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.36. **Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitbaseP"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.40. | ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |

**Description:** For dispatchable units, this value represents the economic active power basepoint, for units that are not dispatchable, this value represents the fixed generation value. The value shall be between the operating low and high limits.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_GeneratingUnitcontrolDeadband"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.41. | ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

**Description:** Unit control error deadband. When a unit's desired active power change is less than this deadband, then no control pulses will be sent to the unit.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i3_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.6.5.4.46. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > WindGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5. ##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpSchedule"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpSchedule`

|                           |                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                                                                                         |
| **Same definition as**    | [GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpSchedule](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpSchedule) |

**Description:** The generating unit's Operator-approved current operating schedule (or plan), typically produced with the aid of unit commitment type analyses. The X-axis represents absolute time. The Y1-axis represents the status (0=off-line and unavailable: 1=available: 2=must run: 3=must run at fixed power value: etc.). The Y2-axis represents the must run fixed power value where required.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.2. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.GenUnitOpCostCurves`

**Title:** GenUnitOpCostCurve

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                                                                                                  | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [GenUnitOpCostCurve.json](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items) | Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs. |

|                           |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                                                                                   |
| **Same definition as**    | [GenUnitOpCostCurve](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitGenUnitOpCostCurves_items) |

**Description:** Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitgovernorMPL"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.governorMPL`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitgovernorSCD"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.governorSCD`

**Title:** governorSCD

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Governor Speed Changer Droop.   This is the change in generator power output divided by the change in frequency normalized by the nominal power of the generator and the nominal frequency and expressed in percent and negated. A positive value of speed change droop provides additional generator output upon a drop in frequency.

**Description:** High limit for secondary (AGC) control.

| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Low limit for secondary (AGC) control.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitnominalP"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.17. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.nominalP`

**Title:** nominalP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The nominal power of the generating unit.  Used to give precise meaning to percentage based attributes such as the governor speed change droop (governorSCD attribute).
The attribute shall be a positive value equal to or less than RotatingMachine.ratedS.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitnormalPF"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.18. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.normalPF`

**Title:** normalPF

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Generating unit economic participation factor.  The sum of the participation factors across generating units does not have to sum to one.  It is used for representing distributed slack participation factor. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitpenaltyFactor"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.19. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.penaltyFactor`

**Title:** penaltyFactor

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Defined as: 1 / ( 1 - Incremental Transmission Loss); with the Incremental Transmission Loss expressed as a plus or minus value. The typical range of penalty factors is (0.9 to 1.1).

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitraiseRampRate"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.20. ##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.30. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.31. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnittotalEfficiency"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.32. **Description:** The efficiency of the unit in converting the fuel into electrical energy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.33. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.35. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.36. **Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.37. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitallocSpinResP"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.38. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.allocSpinResP`

**Title:** allocSpinResP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The planned unused capacity (spinning reserve) which can be used to support emergency load.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitautoCntrlMarginP"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.39. |                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The planned unused capacity which can be used to support automatic control overruns.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitbaseP"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.40. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.baseP`

**Title:** baseP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** For dispatchable units, this value represents the economic active power basepoint, for units that are not dispatchable, this value represents the fixed generation value. The value shall be between the operating low and high limits.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitcontrolDeadband"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.41. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > GeneratingUnit.controlDeadband`

**Title:** controlDeadband

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Unit control error deadband. When a unit's desired active power change is less than this deadband, then no control pulses will be sent to the unit.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitcontrolPulseHigh"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.42. ##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitcontrolResponseRate"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.44. ##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_GeneratingUnitefficiency"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.45. ##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i4_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.6.5.5.46. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.GeneratingUnit > oneOf > ThermalGeneratingUnit > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_SynchronousMachineikk"></a>1.1.1.6.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > SynchronousMachine.ikk`

**Title:** ikk

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** Steady-state short-circuit current (in A for the profile) of generator with compound excitation during 3-phase short circuit.
- Ikk=0: Generator with no compound excitation.
- Ikk<>0: Generator with compound excitation.
Ikk is used to calculate the minimum steady-state short-circuit current for generators with compound excitation.
(4.6.1.2 in IEC 60909-0:2001).
Used only for single fed short circuit on a generator. (4.3.4.2. in IEC 60909-0:2001).

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_SynchronousMachinemanualToAVR"></a>1.1.1.6.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > SynchronousMachine.manualToAVR`

**Title:** manualToAVR

|                        |                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [ShuntCompensator.aVRDelay](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatoraVRDelay) |

**Description:** Time delay required when switching from Manual to Automatic Voltage Regulation. This value is used in the accelerating power reference frame for powerflow solutions.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_SynchronousMachineoperatingMode"></a>1.1.1.6.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > SynchronousMachine.operatingMode`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_SynchronousMachiner"></a>1.1.1.6.17. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > SynchronousMachine.r`

**Title:** r

|                        |                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Equivalent resistance (RG) of generator. RG is considered for the calculation of all currents, except for the calculation of the peak current ip. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_SynchronousMachineshortCircuitRotorType"></a>1.1.1.6.24. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > SynchronousMachine.shortCircuitRotorType`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_SynchronousMachinetype"></a>1.1.1.6.29. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > SynchronousMachine.type`

**Title:** type

|                |                               |
| -------------- | ----------------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`            |
| **Required**   | No                            |
| **Defined in** | ./SynchronousMachineKind.json |

**Description:** Modes that this synchronous machine can operate in.

Must be one of:
* "generator"
* "condenser"
* "generatorOrCondenser"
* "motor"
* "generatorOrMotor"
* "motorOrCondenser"
* "generatorOrCondenserOrMotor"

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_SynchronousMachinevoltageRegulationRange"></a>1.1.1.6.30. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > SynchronousMachine.voltageRegulationRange`

**Title:** voltageRegulationRange

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Range of generator voltage regulation (PG in IEC 60909-0) used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KG defined in IEC 60909-0.
This attribute is used to describe the operating voltage of the generating unit.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_AsynchronousMachinenominalSpeed"></a>1.1.1.6.31. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > AsynchronousMachine.nominalSpeed`

|                |                      |
| -------------- | -------------------- |
| **Type**       | `object or number`   |
| **Required**   | No                   |
| **Defined in** | ./RotationSpeed.json |

| - [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_AsynchronousMachinenominalSpeed_unit )             | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit )             | nan               |
| - [value](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_AsynchronousMachinenominalSpeed_value )           | No      | number           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                             | nan               |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachinep"></a>1.1.1.6.52. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.p`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |

**Description:** Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineq"></a>1.1.1.6.53. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > RotatingMachine.q`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.6.54. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.1.6.55. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.6.56. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.6.57. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.6.58. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_AsynchronousMachineasynchronousMachineType"></a>1.1.1.6.59. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > AsynchronousMachine.asynchronousMachineType`

**Title:** asynchronousMachineType

|                |                                |
| -------------- | ------------------------------ |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`             |
| **Required**   | No                             |
| **Defined in** | ./AsynchronousMachineKind.json |

**Description:** Indicates the type of Asynchronous Machine (motor or generator).

Must be one of:
* "generator"
* "motor"

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.6.60. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.6.61. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.1.6.62. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_SynchronousMachineaVRToManualLag"></a>1.1.1.6.63. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > SynchronousMachine.aVRToManualLag`

**Title:** aVRToManualLag

|                        |                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [ShuntCompensator.aVRDelay](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatoraVRDelay) |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_SynchronousMachinebaseQ"></a>1.1.1.6.65. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > RotatingMachine > SynchronousMachine.baseQ`

**Title:** baseQ

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Default base reactive power value. This value represents the initial reactive power that can be used by any application function.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer"></a>1.1.2. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer`

|                           |                                                                           |

| **Type**                  | `combining`                                                               |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./EnergyConsumer.json                                                     |

**Description:** Generic user of energy - a  point of consumption on the power system model.
EnergyConsumer.pfixed, .qfixed, .pfixedPct and .qfixedPct have meaning only if there is no LoadResponseCharacteristic associated with EnergyConsumer or if LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is set to False.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerAction"></a>1.1.2.1.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerAction`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic"></a>1.1.2.1.5. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./LoadResponseCharacteristic.json                                         |

**Description:** Models the characteristic response of the load demand due to changes in system conditions such as voltage and frequency. It is not related to demand response.
If LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is True, the exponential voltage or frequency dependent models are specified and used as to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model.
The equations to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model are internal to the power flow calculation, hence they use different quantities depending on the use case of the data exchange. 
The equations for exponential voltage dependent load model injected power are: 
pInjection= Pnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent
qInjection= Qnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent
Where: 
1) * means "multiply" and ** is "raised to power of";
2) Pnominal and Qnominal represent the active power and reactive power at nominal voltage as any load described by the voltage exponential model shall be given at nominal voltage.  This means that EnergyConsumer.p and EnergyConsumer.q  are at nominal voltage.
3) After power flow is solved: 
-pInjection and qInjection correspond to SvPowerflow.p and SvPowerflow.q respectively.  
- Voltage corresponds to SvVoltage.v at the TopologicalNode where the load is connected.

| Property                                                                                                                                                                                                | Pattern | Type    | Deprecated | Definition | Title/Description  |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ------- | ---------- | ---------- | ------------------ |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.pConstantCurrent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicpConstantCurrent )     | No      | number  | No         | -          | pConstantCurrent   |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.pConstantImpedance](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicpConstantImpedance ) | No      | number  | No         | -          | pConstantImpedance |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.pConstantPower](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicpConstantPower )         | No      | number  | No         | -          | pConstantPower     |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.pFrequencyExponent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicpFrequencyExponent ) | No      | number  | No         | -          | pFrequencyExponent |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicpVoltageExponent )     | No      | number  | No         | -          | pVoltageExponent   |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.qConstantCurrent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicqConstantCurrent )     | No      | number  | No         | -          | qConstantCurrent   |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.qConstantImpedance](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicqConstantImpedance ) | No      | number  | No         | -          | qConstantImpedance |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.qConstantPower](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicqConstantPower )         | No      | number  | No         | -          | qConstantPower     |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.qFrequencyExponent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicqFrequencyExponent ) | No      | number  | No         | -          | qFrequencyExponent |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicqVoltageExponent )     | No      | number  | No         | -          | qVoltageExponent   |
| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectname )                                                 | No      | string  | No         | -          | name               |
| - [IdentifiedObject.description](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectdescription )                                   | No      | string  | No         | -          | description        |
| - [IdentifiedObject.aliasName](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectaliasName )                                       | No      | string  | No         | -          | aliasName          |
| - [IdentifiedObject.mRID](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectmRID )                                                 | No      | string  | No         | -          | mRID               |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicexponentModel )           | No      | boolean | No         | -          | exponentModel      |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicpConstantCurrent"></a>1.1.2.1.5.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic > LoadResponseCharacteristic.pConstantCurrent`

**Title:** pConstantCurrent

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Portion of active power load modelled as constant current.

|              |          |

| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.2.1.5.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.2.1.5.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicexponentModel"></a>1.1.2.1.5.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic > LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel`

**Title:** exponentModel

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Indicates the exponential voltage dependency model is to be used. If false, the coefficient model is to be used.
The exponential voltage dependency model consist of the attributes:
- pVoltageExponent
- qVoltageExponent
- pFrequencyExponent
- qFrequencyExponent.
The coefficient model consist of the attributes:
- pConstantImpedance
- pConstantCurrent
- pConstantPower
- qConstantImpedance
- qConstantCurrent
- qConstantPower.
The sum of pConstantImpedance, pConstantCurrent and pConstantPower shall equal 1.
The sum of qConstantImpedance, qConstantCurrent and qConstantPower shall equal 1.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage"></a>1.1.2.1.6. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhasep"></a>1.1.2.1.7.1.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhasepfixed"></a>1.1.2.1.7.1.2. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase.pfixed`

**Title:** pfixed

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power of the load that is a fixed quantity. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhasepfixedPct"></a>1.1.2.1.7.1.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase.pfixedPct`

**Title:** pfixedPct

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Fixed active power as per cent of load group fixed active power. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhasephase"></a>1.1.2.1.7.1.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase.phase`

**Title:** phase

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.phase](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhasephase) |

**Description:** Phase of this energy consumer component.   If the energy consumer is wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point.  If the energy consumer is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy consumer connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhaseqfixed"></a>1.1.2.1.7.1.5. ##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerp"></a>1.1.2.1.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.p`

| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
