##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.2.1.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerq"></a>1.1.2.1.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.2.1.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.2.1.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumercustomerCount"></a>1.1.2.1.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.customerCount`

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerpfixed"></a>1.1.2.1.16. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.pfixed`

**Description:** Active power of the load that is a fixed quantity and does not vary as load group value varies. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.2.1.22. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.2.1.23. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.2.1.24. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

| - [EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic ) | No      | object           | No         | Same as [EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic )                                                                               | Models the characteristic response of the load demand due to changes in system conditions such as voltage and frequency. It is not related to demand response.<br />If LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is True, the exponential voltage or frequency dependent models are specified and used as to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model.<br />The equations to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model are internal to the power flow calculation, hence they use different quantities depending on the use case of the data exchange. <br />The equations for exponential voltage dependent load model injected power are: <br />pInjection= Pnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent<br />qInjection= Qnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent<br />Where: <br />1) * means "multiply" and ** is "raised to power of";<br />2) Pnominal and Qnominal represent the active power and reactive power at nominal voltage as any load described by the voltage exponential model shall be given at nominal voltage.  This means that EnergyConsumer.p and EnergyConsumer.q  are at nominal voltage.<br />3) After power flow is solved: <br />-pInjection and qInjection correspond to SvPowerflow.p and SvPowerflow.q respectively.  <br />- Voltage corresponds to SvVoltage.v at the TopologicalNode where the load is connected. |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>1.1.2.2.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerAction"></a>1.1.2.2.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerAction`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic"></a>1.1.2.2.5. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic`

|                           |                                                                                                                                                     |
| ------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                                                           |
| **Same definition as**    | [EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic) |

**Description:** Models the characteristic response of the load demand due to changes in system conditions such as voltage and frequency. It is not related to demand response.
If LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is True, the exponential voltage or frequency dependent models are specified and used as to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model.
The equations to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model are internal to the power flow calculation, hence they use different quantities depending on the use case of the data exchange. 
The equations for exponential voltage dependent load model injected power are: 
pInjection= Pnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent
qInjection= Qnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent
Where: 
1) * means "multiply" and ** is "raised to power of";
2) Pnominal and Qnominal represent the active power and reactive power at nominal voltage as any load described by the voltage exponential model shall be given at nominal voltage.  This means that EnergyConsumer.p and EnergyConsumer.q  are at nominal voltage.
3) After power flow is solved: 
-pInjection and qInjection correspond to SvPowerflow.p and SvPowerflow.q respectively.  
- Voltage corresponds to SvVoltage.v at the TopologicalNode where the load is connected.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage"></a>1.1.2.2.6. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerp"></a>1.1.2.2.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.2.2.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerq"></a>1.1.2.2.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.2.2.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.2.2.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumercustomerCount"></a>1.1.2.2.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.customerCount`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.2.2.23. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.2.2.24. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.2.2.25. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage"></a>1.1.3.6. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_EnergySourcePhasephase"></a>1.1.3.7.1.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase.phase`

**Title:** phase

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.phase](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhasephase) |

**Description:** Phase of this energy source component.   If the energy source wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point.  If the energy source is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy source connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.3.7.1.2. ##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.3.7.1.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.3.7.1.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.3.7.1.5. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.3.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.3.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.3.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.3.16. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter"></a>1.2. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./ACDCConverter.json                                                      |

**Description:** A unit with valves for three phases, together with unit control equipment, essential protective and switching devices, DC storage capacitors, phase reactors and auxiliaries, if any, used for conversion.

| Property                                                         | Pattern | Type   | Deprecated | Definition            | Title/Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ------ | ---------- | --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - [VsConverter](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter ) | No      | object | No         | In ./VsConverter.json | DC side of the voltage source converter (VSC).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| - [CsConverter](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter ) | No      | object | No         | In ./CsConverter.json | DC side of the current source converter (CSC).<br />The firing angle controls the dc voltage at the converter, both for rectifier and inverter. The difference between the dc voltages of the rectifier and inverter determines the dc current. The extinction angle is used to limit the dc voltage at the inverter, if needed, and is not used in active power control. The firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters are the primary means to control a current source dc line. Higher level controls are built on top, e.g. dc voltage, dc current and active power. From a steady state perspective it is sufficient to specify the wanted active power transfer (ACDCConverter.targetPpcc) and the control functions will set the dc voltage, dc current, firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters to meet this. Therefore attributes targetAlpha and targetGamma are not applicable in this case.<br />The reactive power consumed by the converter is a function of the firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filter, which can be approximated with half of the active power. The losses is a function of the dc voltage and dc current.<br />The attributes minAlpha and maxAlpha define the range of firing angles for rectifier operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 10-18 degrees.<br />The attributes minGamma and maxGamma define the range of extinction angles for inverter operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 17-20 degrees. |

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter"></a>1.2.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./VsConverter.json                                                        |

**Description:** DC side of the voltage source converter (VSC).

| Property                                                                                                                | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | Title/Description      |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_PowerSystemResourceLocation )           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | -                      |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>1.2.1.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

**Title:** Terminal

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                    | Description                                                                                                                                            |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [Terminal.json](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items) | An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes. |

**Description:** An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterp"></a>1.2.1.7. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power at the point of common coupling. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution in the case a simplified power flow model is used.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterq"></a>1.2.1.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.q`

**Title:** q

| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power at the point of common coupling. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution in the case a simplified power flow model is used.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.2.1.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > IdentifiedObject.description`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterminP"></a>1.2.1.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.minP`

**Title:** minP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Minimum active power limit. The value is overwritten by values of VsCapabilityCurve, if present.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.2.1.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.2.1.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterratedUdc"></a>1.2.1.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.ratedUdc`

**Title:** ratedUdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Rated converter DC voltage, also called UdN. The attribute shall be a positive value. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. For instance a bipolar HVDC link with value  200 kV has a 400kV difference between the dc lines.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.2.1.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterpPccControl"></a>1.2.1.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > VsConverter.pPccControl`

**Title:** pPccControl

|                |                          |
| -------------- | ------------------------ |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`       |
| **Required**   | No                       |
| **Defined in** | ./VsPpccControlKind.json |

**Description:** Kind of control of real power and/or DC voltage.

Must be one of:
* "pPcc"
* "udc"
* "pPccAndUdcDroop"
* "pPccAndUdcDroopWithCompensation"
* "pPccAndUdcDroopPilot"
* "phasePcc"

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterbaseS"></a>1.2.1.16. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.baseS`

**Title:** baseS

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedS](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedS) |

**Description:** Base apparent power of the converter pole. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterswitchingLoss"></a>1.2.1.17. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.switchingLoss`

|                |                                  |
| -------------- | -------------------------------- |
| **Type**       | `object or number`               |
| **Required**   | No                               |
| **Defined in** | ./ActivePowerPerCurrentFlow.json |

**Description:** Switching losses, relative to the base apparent power 'baseS'. Refer to poleLossP. The attribute shall be a positive value.

| Property                                                                                              | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                    | Title/Description |

| - [unit](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterswitchingLoss_unit )             | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit )             | nan               |
| - [value](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterswitchingLoss_value )           | No      | number           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                             | nan               |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterswitchingLoss_multiplier"></a>1.2.1.17.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.switchingLoss > multiplier`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                                   |

**Description:** nan

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterswitchingLoss_unit"></a>1.2.1.17.2. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.switchingLoss > unit`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                       |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                       |
| **Default**            | `"WPerA"`                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [unit](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit) |

**Description:** nan

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_EquipmentinService"></a>1.2.1.18. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConvertermaxModulationIndex"></a>1.2.1.26. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > VsConverter.maxModulationIndex`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterpoleLossP"></a>1.2.1.38. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.poleLossP`

**Title:** poleLossP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The active power loss at a DC Pole 
= idleLoss + switchingLoss*|Idc| + resitiveLoss*Idc^2.
For lossless operation Pdc=Pac.
For rectifier operation with losses Pdc=Pac-lossP.
For inverter operation with losses Pdc=Pac+lossP.
It is converters state variable used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterresistiveLoss"></a>1.2.1.39. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.resistiveLoss`

**Description:** It is converters configuration data used in power flow. Refer to poleLossP. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.2.1.44. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.2.1.45. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.2.1.46. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter"></a>1.2.2. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./CsConverter.json                                                        |

**Description:** DC side of the current source converter (CSC).
The firing angle controls the dc voltage at the converter, both for rectifier and inverter. The difference between the dc voltages of the rectifier and inverter determines the dc current. The extinction angle is used to limit the dc voltage at the inverter, if needed, and is not used in active power control. The firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters are the primary means to control a current source dc line. Higher level controls are built on top, e.g. dc voltage, dc current and active power. From a steady state perspective it is sufficient to specify the wanted active power transfer (ACDCConverter.targetPpcc) and the control functions will set the dc voltage, dc current, firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters to meet this. Therefore attributes targetAlpha and targetGamma are not applicable in this case.
The reactive power consumed by the converter is a function of the firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filter, which can be approximated with half of the active power. The losses is a function of the dc voltage and dc current.
The attributes minAlpha and maxAlpha define the range of firing angles for rectifier operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 10-18 degrees.
The attributes minGamma and maxGamma define the range of extinction angles for inverter operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 17-20 degrees.

| Property                                                                                                                | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | Title/Description      |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_PowerSystemResourceLocation )           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | -                      |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction ) | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.Terminals](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ConductingEquipmentTerminals )         | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | Terminal               |
| - [ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage )     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.SvStatus](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus )           | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | SvStatus               |
| - [CsConverter.alpha](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverteralpha )                                 | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta )                                                                                                                                    | alpha                  |
| - [CsConverter.gamma](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertergamma )                                 | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta )                                                                                                                                    | gamma                  |
| - [CsConverter.maxAlpha](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertermaxAlpha )                           | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta )                                                                                                                                    | maxAlpha               |
| - [CsConverter.maxGamma](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertermaxGamma )                           | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta )                                                                                                                                    | maxGamma               |
| - [CsConverter.minAlpha](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverterminAlpha )                           | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta )                                                                                                                                    | minAlpha               |
| - [CsConverter.minGamma](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverterminGamma )                           | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta )                                                                                                                                    | minGamma               |
| - [CsConverter.targetAlpha](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertertargetAlpha )                     | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta )                                                                                                                                    | targetAlpha            |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>1.2.2.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

**Title:** Terminal

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                    | Description                                                                                                                                            |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [Terminal.json](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items) | An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes. |
