##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverteralpha"></a>1.2.2.6. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.alpha`

**Title:** alpha

|                        |                                                                                      |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                   |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                   |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Firing angle that determines the dc voltage at the converter dc terminal. Typical value between 10 degrees and 18 degrees for a rectifier. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertergamma"></a>1.2.2.7. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.gamma`

**Title:** gamma

|                        |                                                                                      |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                   |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                   |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Extinction angle. It is used to limit the dc voltage at the inverter if needed. Typical value between 17 degrees and 20 degrees for an inverter. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertermaxAlpha"></a>1.2.2.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.maxAlpha`

**Title:** maxAlpha

|                        |                                                                                      |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                   |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                   |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Maximum firing angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertermaxGamma"></a>1.2.2.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.maxGamma`

**Title:** maxGamma

|                        |                                                                                      |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                   |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                   |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Maximum extinction angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverterminAlpha"></a>1.2.2.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.minAlpha`

**Title:** minAlpha

|                        |                                                                                      |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                   |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                   |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Minimum firing angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverterminGamma"></a>1.2.2.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.minGamma`

**Title:** minGamma

|                        |                                                                                      |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                   |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                   |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Minimum extinction angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertertargetAlpha"></a>1.2.2.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.targetAlpha`

**Title:** targetAlpha

|                        |                                                                                      |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                   |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                   |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Target firing angle. It is converters control variable used in power flow. It is only applicable for rectifier if continuous tap changer control is used. Allowed values are within the range minAlpha<=targetAlpha<=maxAlpha. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertertargetGamma"></a>1.2.2.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.targetGamma`

**Title:** targetGamma

|                        |                                                                                      |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                   |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                   |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Target extinction angle. It is converters control variable used in power flow. It is only applicable for inverter if continuous tap changer control is used. Allowed values are within the range minGamma<=targetGamma<=maxGamma. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertertargetIdc"></a>1.2.2.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.targetIdc`

**Title:** targetIdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** DC current target value. It is converters control variable used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverterminIdc"></a>1.2.2.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.minIdc`

**Title:** minIdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The minimum direct current (Id) on the DC side at which the converter should operate. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverteroperatingMode"></a>1.2.2.16. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.operatingMode`

**Title:** operatingMode

|                |                            |
| -------------- | -------------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`         |
| **Required**   | No                         |
| **Defined in** | ./CsOperatingModeKind.json |

**Description:** Indicates whether the DC pole is operating as an inverter or as a rectifier. It is converters control variable used in power flow.

Must be one of:
* "inverter"
* "rectifier"

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterp"></a>1.2.2.17. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power at the point of common coupling. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution in the case a simplified power flow model is used.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterq"></a>1.2.2.18. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power at the point of common coupling. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution in the case a simplified power flow model is used.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.2.2.19. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterminP"></a>1.2.2.20. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.minP`

**Title:** minP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Minimum active power limit. The value is overwritten by values of VsCapabilityCurve, if present.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.2.2.21. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.2.2.22. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.2.2.23. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.2.2.24. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterbaseS"></a>1.2.2.25. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.baseS`

**Title:** baseS

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedS](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedS) |

**Description:** Base apparent power of the converter pole. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterswitchingLoss"></a>1.2.2.26. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.switchingLoss`

**Title:** switchingLoss

|                        |                                                                                                          |
| ---------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                       |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                       |
| **Same definition as** | [ACDCConverter.switchingLoss](#ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterswitchingLoss) |

**Description:** Switching losses, relative to the base apparent power 'baseS'. Refer to poleLossP. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_EquipmentinService"></a>1.2.2.27. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConvertertargetPpcc"></a>1.2.2.28. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.targetPpcc`

**Title:** targetPpcc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Real power injection target in AC grid, at point of common coupling.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConvertertargetUdc"></a>1.2.2.29. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.targetUdc`

**Title:** targetUdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Target value for DC voltage magnitude. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConvertervalveU0"></a>1.2.2.30. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.valveU0`

**Title:** valveU0

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Valve threshold voltage, also called Uvalve. Forward voltage drop when the valve is conducting. Used in loss calculations, i.e. the switchLoss depend on numberOfValves * valveU0.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverternumberOfValves"></a>1.2.2.31. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.numberOfValves`

**Title:** numberOfValves

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Number of valves in the converter. Used in loss calculations.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverteridc"></a>1.2.2.32. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.idc`

**Title:** idc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** Converter DC current, also called Id. It is converters state variable, result from power flow.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverteridleLoss"></a>1.2.2.33. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.idleLoss`

**Title:** idleLoss

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power loss in pole at no power transfer. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertermaxIdc"></a>1.2.2.34. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.maxIdc`

**Title:** maxIdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The maximum direct current (Id) on the DC side at which the converter should operate. It is converters configuration data use in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConvertermaxUdc"></a>1.2.2.35. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.maxUdc`

**Title:** maxUdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The maximum voltage on the DC side at which the converter should operate. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterminUdc"></a>1.2.2.36. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.minUdc`

**Title:** minUdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The minimum voltage on the DC side at which the converter should operate. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterpoleLossP"></a>1.2.2.37. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.poleLossP`

**Title:** poleLossP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The active power loss at a DC Pole 
= idleLoss + switchingLoss*|Idc| + resitiveLoss*Idc^2.
For lossless operation Pdc=Pac.
For rectifier operation with losses Pdc=Pac-lossP.
For inverter operation with losses Pdc=Pac+lossP.
It is converters state variable used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverterratedIdc"></a>1.2.2.38. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.ratedIdc`

**Title:** ratedIdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** Rated converter DC current, also called IdN. The attribute shall be a positive value. It is converters configuration data used in power flow.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterratedUdc"></a>1.2.2.39. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.ratedUdc`

**Title:** ratedUdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Rated converter DC voltage, also called UdN. The attribute shall be a positive value. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. For instance a bipolar HVDC link with value  200 kV has a 400kV difference between the dc lines.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterresistiveLoss"></a>1.2.2.40. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.resistiveLoss`

**Title:** resistiveLoss

|                        |                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** It is converters configuration data used in power flow. Refer to poleLossP. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConvertermaxP"></a>1.2.2.41. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.maxP`

**Title:** maxP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Maximum active power limit. The value is overwritten by values of VsCapabilityCurve, if present.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverteruc"></a>1.2.2.42. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.uc`

**Title:** uc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Line-to-line converter voltage, the voltage at the AC side of the valve. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterudc"></a>1.2.2.43. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.udc`

**Title:** udc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Converter voltage at the DC side, also called Ud. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.2.2.44. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverterpPccControl"></a>1.2.2.45. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.pPccControl`

**Title:** pPccControl

|                |                          |
| -------------- | ------------------------ |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`       |
| **Required**   | No                       |
| **Defined in** | ./CsPpccControlKind.json |

**Description:** Kind of active power control.

Must be one of:
* "activePower"
* "dcVoltage"
* "dcCurrent"

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.2.2.46. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment"></a>1.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./EquivalentEquipment.json                                                |

**Description:** The class represents equivalent objects that are the result of a network reduction. The class is the base for equivalent objects of different types.

| Property                                                                               | Pattern | Type   | Deprecated | Definition                    | Title/Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ------ | ---------- | ----------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - [EquivalentInjection](#ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection ) | No      | object | No         | In ./EquivalentInjection.json | This class represents equivalent injections (generation or load).  Voltage regulation is allowed only at the point of connection.                                                                                                            |
| - [EquivalentBranch](#ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch )       | No      | object | No         | In ./EquivalentBranch.json    | The class represents equivalent branches. In cases where a transformer phase shift is modelled and the EquivalentBranch is spanning the same nodes, the impedance quantities for the EquivalentBranch shall consider the needed phase shift. |
| - [EquivalentShunt](#ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt )         | No      | object | No         | In ./EquivalentShunt.json     | The class represents equivalent shunts.                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>1.3.1.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

**Title:** Terminal

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                                  | Description                                                                                                                                            |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [Terminal.json](#ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items) | An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes. |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage"></a>1.3.1.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionmaxQ"></a>1.3.1.7. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.maxQ`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

**Description:** Maximum reactive power of the injection.  Used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange. Not used for short circuit modelling.  If maxQ and minQ are not used ReactiveCapabilityCurve can be used.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionr"></a>1.3.1.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.r`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionregulationCapability"></a>1.3.1.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.regulationCapability`

**Title:** regulationCapability

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies whether or not the EquivalentInjection has the capability to regulate the local voltage. If true the EquivalentInjection can regulate. If false the EquivalentInjection cannot regulate. ReactiveCapabilityCurve can only be associated with EquivalentInjection  if the flag is true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionregulationStatus"></a>1.3.1.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.regulationStatus`

**Title:** regulationStatus

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the regulation status of the EquivalentInjection.  True is regulating.  False is not regulating.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionregulationTarget"></a>1.3.1.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.regulationTarget`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The target voltage for voltage regulation. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionp"></a>1.3.1.20. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.p`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                 |

**Description:** Equivalent active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionq"></a>1.3.1.21. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.q`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.3.1.22. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.3.1.23. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.3.1.24. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquipmentinService"></a>1.3.1.25. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.3.1.26. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.3.1.27. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.3.1.28. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch"></a>1.3.2. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./EquivalentBranch.json                                                   |

**Description:** The class represents equivalent branches. In cases where a transformer phase shift is modelled and the EquivalentBranch is spanning the same nodes, the impedance quantities for the EquivalentBranch shall consider the needed phase shift.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>1.3.2.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchr21"></a>1.3.2.18. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.r21`

**Title:** r21

|                        |                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Resistance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1 .Used for steady state power flow. This attribute is optional and represent unbalanced network such as off-nominal phase shifter. If only EquivalentBranch.r is given, then EquivalentBranch.r21 is assumed equal to EquivalentBranch.r.
Usage rule : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.3.2.25. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.3.2.26. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentLinehardeningCost"></a>1.3.2.27. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentLine.hardeningCost`

|                           |                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                                                                    |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.3.2.28. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquipmentinService"></a>1.3.2.29. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.3.2.30. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.3.2.31. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.3.2.32. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction"></a>1.3.3.2. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > PowerSystemResource.GenericAction`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>1.3.3.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.3.3.6. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.3.3.7. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.3.3.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_EquivalentShuntb"></a>1.3.3.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > EquivalentShunt.b`

**Title:** b

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Same definition as** | [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.bPerSection](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasebPerSection) |

**Description:** Positive sequence shunt susceptance.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_EquivalentShuntg"></a>1.3.3.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > EquivalentShunt.g`

**Title:** g

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Same definition as** | [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.gPerSection](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasegPerSection) |

**Description:** Positive sequence shunt conductance.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_EquipmentinService"></a>1.3.3.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.3.3.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.3.3.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.3.3.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.3.3.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Connector"></a>1.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Connector`

**Description:** A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation and are modelled with a single logical terminal.
