### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor"></a>1.5. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Conductor.json                                                          |

**Description:** Combination of conducting material with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry current between points in the power system.

| Property                                                         | Pattern | Type   | Deprecated | Definition              | Title/Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ------ | ---------- | ----------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - [ACLineSegment](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment ) | No      | object | No         | In ./ACLineSegment.json | A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system.<br />For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment.  Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances.<br />The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch. |
| - [WireSegment](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment )     | No      | object | No         | In ./WireSegment.json   | A two terminal and power conducting device of negligible impedance and length represented as zero impedance device that can be used to connect auxiliary equipment to its terminals.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment"></a>1.5.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./ACLineSegment.json                                                      |

**Description:** A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system.
For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment.  Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances.
The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch.

| Property                                                                                                                            | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                                     | Title/Description          |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_PowerSystemResourceLocation )                         | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                              | -                          |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction )               | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                              | -                          |
| - [ConductingEquipment.Terminals](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ConductingEquipmentTerminals )                       | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                              | Terminal                   |
| - [ACLineSegment.PerLengthImpedance](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentPerLengthImpedance )                 | No      | Combination      | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                              | -                          |
| - [ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase )                 | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                              | ACLineSegmentPhase         |
| - [ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage )                   | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                              | -                          |
| - [ACLineSegment.WireSpacingInfo](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentWireSpacingInfo )                       | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                              | -                          |
| - [PowerSystemResource.AssetDatasheet](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_PowerSystemResourceAssetDatasheet )             | No      | Combination      | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                              | -                          |
| - [ConductingEquipment.SvStatus](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus )                         | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                              | SvStatus                   |
| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_IdentifiedObjectname )                                       | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                              | name                       |
| - [Equipment.aggregate](#ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_Equipmentaggregate )                                           | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                              | aggregate                  |

**Title:** phase

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_ACLineSegmentPhasesequenceNumber"></a>1.5.1.5.1.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase.sequenceNumber`

**Title:** sequenceNumber

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Number designation for this line segment phase. Each line segment phase within a line segment should have a unique sequence number. This is useful for unbalanced modelling to bind the mathematical model (PhaseImpedanceData of PerLengthPhaseImpedance) with the connectivity model (this class) and the physical model (WirePosition) without tight coupling.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.5.1.5.1.5. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.5.1.5.1.6. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.5.1.5.1.7. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.5.1.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.5.1.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.5.1.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_Conductorlength"></a>1.5.1.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Conductor.length`

**Title:** length

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight) |

**Description:** Segment length for calculating line section capabilities.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.5.1.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.5.1.16. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_EquipmentinService"></a>1.5.1.17. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.5.1.18. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentb0ch"></a>1.5.1.19. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.b0ch`

**Title:** b0ch

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Same definition as** | [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.bPerSection](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasebPerSection) |

**Description:** Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentbch"></a>1.5.1.20. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.bch`

**Title:** bch

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

**Description:** Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.  This value represents the full charging over the full length of the line.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.5.2.5.1.3. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.5.2.5.1.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.5.2.5.1.5. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.5.2.7. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.5.2.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.5.2.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_EquipmentinService"></a>1.5.2.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_Conductorlength"></a>1.5.2.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Conductor.length`

**Title:** length

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight) |

**Description:** Segment length for calculating line section capabilities.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.5.2.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.5.2.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.5.2.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.5.2.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator"></a>1.6. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./EarthFaultCompensator.json                                              |

**Description:** A conducting equipment used to represent a connection to ground which is typically used to compensate earth faults.   An earth fault compensator device modelled with a single terminal implies a second terminal solidly connected to ground.  If two terminals are modelled, the ground is not assumed and normal connection rules apply.

| Property                                                                                                            | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                   | Title/Description      |

|                        |                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilxGroundNominal"></a>1.6.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.xGroundNominal`

**Title:** xGroundNominal

|                        |                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** The nominal reactance.  This is the operating point (normally over compensation) that is defined based on the resonance point in the healthy network condition.  The impedance is calculated based on nominal voltage divided by position current.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.6.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.6.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.6.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_EarthFaultCompensatorr"></a>1.6.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > EarthFaultCompensator.r`

**Title:** r

|                        |                                                                                                                                               |

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.6.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.6.16. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilmode"></a>1.6.19. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.mode`

**Title:** mode

|                |                             |
| -------------- | --------------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`          |
| **Required**   | No                          |
| **Defined in** | ./PetersenCoilModeKind.json |

**Description:** The mode of operation of the Petersen coil.

Must be one of:
* "fixed"
* "manual"
* "automaticPositioning"

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilnominalU"></a>1.6.20. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.nominalU`

**Title:** nominalU

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The nominal voltage for which the coil is designed.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoiloffsetCurrent"></a>1.6.21. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.offsetCurrent`

**Title:** offsetCurrent

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The offset current that the Petersen coil controller is operating from the resonant point.  This is normally a fixed amount for which the controller is configured and could be positive or negative.  Typically 0 to 60 A depending on voltage and resonance conditions.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilpositionCurrent"></a>1.6.22. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.positionCurrent`

**Title:** positionCurrent

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The control current used to control the Petersen coil also known as the position current.  Typically in the range of 20 mA to 200 mA.

### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Clamp"></a>1.7. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Clamp.json                                                              |

**Description:** A Clamp is a galvanic connection at a line segment where other equipment is connected. A Clamp does not cut the line segment. 
A Clamp is ConductingEquipment and has one Terminal with an associated ConnectivityNode. Any other ConductingEquipment can be connected to the Clamp ConnectivityNode.

| Property                                                                                            | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                             | Title/Description      |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#ConductingEquipment_Clamp_PowerSystemResourceLocation )           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                      | -                      |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#ConductingEquipment_Clamp_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction ) | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                      | -                      |
| - [Clamp.ClampAction](#ConductingEquipment_Clamp_ClampClampAction )                                 | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                      | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.Terminals](#ConductingEquipment_Clamp_ConductingEquipmentTerminals )         | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                      | Terminal               |
| - [Clamp.ACLineSegment](#ConductingEquipment_Clamp_ClampACLineSegment )                             | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                      | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage](#ConductingEquipment_Clamp_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage )     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                      | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.SvStatus](#ConductingEquipment_Clamp_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus )           | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                      | SvStatus               |
| - [Equipment.aggregate](#ConductingEquipment_Clamp_Equipmentaggregate )                             | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                      | aggregate              |
| - [Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled](#ConductingEquipment_Clamp_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled )   | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                      | networkAnalysisEnabled |
| - [Clamp.lengthFromTerminal1](#ConductingEquipment_Clamp_ClamplengthFromTerminal1 )                 | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight ) | lengthFromTerminal1    |
| - [Equipment.normallyInService](#ConductingEquipment_Clamp_EquipmentnormallyInService )             | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                      | normallyInService      |

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Clamp_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>1.7.4. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Clamp_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.7.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Clamp_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.7.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Clamp_ClamplengthFromTerminal1"></a>1.7.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Clamp.lengthFromTerminal1`

**Title:** lengthFromTerminal1

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight) |

**Description:** The length to the place where the clamp is located starting from side one of the line segment, i.e. the line segment terminal with sequence number equal to 1.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Clamp_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.7.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Clamp_EquipmentinService"></a>1.7.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Clamp_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.7.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Clamp_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.7.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Clamp_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.7.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Clamp_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.7.16. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

### <a name="ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator"></a>1.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator`

|                           |                                                                           |

| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./SeriesCompensator.json                                                  |

**Description:** A Series Compensator is a series capacitor or reactor or an AC transmission line without charging susceptance.  It is a two terminal device.

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator_SeriesCompensatorvaristorPresent"></a>1.8.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent`

**Title:** varistorPresent

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Describe if a metal oxide varistor (mov) for over voltage protection is configured in parallel with the series compensator. It is used for short circuit calculations.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator_SeriesCompensatorvaristorRatedCurrent"></a>1.8.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > SeriesCompensator.varistorRatedCurrent`

**Title:** varistorRatedCurrent

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The maximum current the varistor is designed to handle at specified duration. It is used for short circuit calculations and exchanged only if SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent is true.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator_SeriesCompensatorvaristorVoltageThreshold"></a>1.8.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > SeriesCompensator.varistorVoltageThreshold`

**Title:** varistorVoltageThreshold

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The dc voltage at which the varistor starts conducting. It is used for short circuit calculations and exchanged only if SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent is true.

### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Ground"></a>1.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Ground.json                                                             |

**Description:** A point where the system is grounded used for connecting conducting equipment to ground. The power system model can have any number of grounds.

| Property                                                                                             | Pattern | Type    | Deprecated | Definition | Title/Description      |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ------- | ---------- | ---------- | ---------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#ConductingEquipment_Ground_PowerSystemResourceLocation )           | No      | string  | No         | -          | -                      |

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Ground_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.9.7. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Ground_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.9.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Ground_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.9.9. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Ground_EquipmentinService"></a>1.9.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Ground_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.9.11. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Ground_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.9.12. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Ground_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.9.13. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Ground_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.9.14. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Switch"></a>1.10. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Switch.json                                                             |

**Description:** A generic device designed to close, or open, or both, one or more electric circuits.  All switches are two terminal devices including grounding switches. The ACDCTerminal.connected at the two sides of the switch shall not be considered for assessing switch connectivity, i.e. only Switch.open, .normalOpen and .locked are relevant.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Switch_SwitchSwitchPhase_items_SwitchPhasenormalOpen"></a>1.10.8.1.1. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase.normalOpen`

**Title:** normalOpen

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Used in cases when no Measurement for the status value is present. If the SwitchPhase has a status measurement the Discrete.normalValue is expected to match with this value.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Switch_SwitchSwitchPhase_items_SwitchPhasephaseSide1"></a>1.10.8.1.2. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase.phaseSide1`

| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.phase](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhasephase) |

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Switch_SwitchSwitchPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.10.8.1.8. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Switch_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.10.15. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Switch_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.10.16. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Switch_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.10.17. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Switch_CutlengthFromTerminal1"></a>1.10.18. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Cut.lengthFromTerminal1`

**Title:** lengthFromTerminal1

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight) |

**Description:** The length to the place where the cut is located starting from side one of the cut line segment, i.e. the line segment Terminal with sequenceNumber equal to 1.

#### <a name="ConductingEquipment_Switch_Switchlocked"></a>1.10.26. Property `Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.locked`

**Title:** locked

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** If true, the switch is locked. The resulting switch state is a combination of locked and Switch.open attributes as follows:
<ul>
	<li>locked=true and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open and locked;</li>
	<li>locked=false and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open;</li>
	<li>locked=false and Switch.open=false. The resulting state is closed.</li>
</ul>
